title: last Thunderbird update is creating havoc- on MacAir
content:
I have a list so long it won't fit here. I can only think to install back to an update 10 days ago. I can't find an option for that- and I am not a proffessional- just a simple user.

I have a MacAir, since installing the latest update, Thunderbird: stalls for so long and can't switch it off or access anything for hours sporadically, it won't save 'sent' emails sporadically, it sends emails full of garbage - numbers, green and black screens, and other illegable content. sporadically. A lot of problems happen the moment I put an image into the content. and then I can't undo it. I can't access the image to move it, to delete it, just stuck. the signature keeps including code. it now says 105% full. Since when did we have a quota? I didn't know how to fix it. So it's now blocking me receiving emails. so I archived, deleted mails and it shifted it. BUT I have never had to do this before and don't want to -I have a busness to run and need to keep records. I can't delete in the future. What is this stupid quota thing?

I can keep going with the problems I have. But I don't have copious amounts of weeks and months to now trouble shoot. So I thought I just take it back to a previous update -say 2 weeks ago before th eproblems started, and not update again until Thunderbird can function on the Mac.

Can anyone help me? I am scared to uninstall, as I don't want to lose my contacts again. (had previous problems with Thunderbird in the last few months) ...now this. and have no idea how to get help? I want to be loyal to thunderbird- but I can't function with it right now.

....anyone?
creator: Kew

title: üzenet letöltési probléma
content: Sziasztok, ma frissült a Thunderbird az új verzióra, egyúttal volt egy windows10 és egy vírusvédelmi szoftver (ESET Endpoint) frissítés is a mai napon, miután minden frissítés lement, a gép újraindult, a beérkező leveleket nem tölti be (kivéve a gmail-t); kifelé tudok küldeni. Egy másik eszközön a teljesen jól működik frissítést követően is a levelező program (azon Win7 van). A következőket ellenőriztük: postafiók beállítások (nem kerültek változtatásra); vírusvédelem és tűzfal kikapcsolása után sem töltötte le az üzeneteket; levelezésben alkalmazott szűrők kikapcsolása sem oldotta meg a problémát. title: Vložení podpisu (nebo textu v HTML formátu ze souboru) do rozepsaného emailu
content:
Dobrý den.

Už jsem skoro přešel na Thunderbild, ale zastavila mě jedna chybějící funkce.

Vím, že Thunderbild umožňuje přiřadit "automatický" podpis ke každému připojenému účtu. Mohu použít jak prostý text, tak drobné formátování v HTML anebo použít HTML soubor s potřebným formátováním. To je OK.

Co ale hledám, je vkládání podpisů přímo v otevřeném emailu a to k aktuálně postavenému kurzoru. Asi by se to nemuselo jmenovat vložení podpisů, ale třeba vložení šablony, neb to lépe vystihuje požadované.

Jde o to, že mám připraveno hodně různých odpovědí či jiných textů, kde vložení HTML textu včetně formátování usnadní rutinní práci. Zde jsem nic takového nenašel.

Přikládám obrázek jak je to elegantně řešeno ve Windows Live Mail 2012, kde jednoduše mám seznam různých podpisů (asi 25) a každý se odkazuje na určitý HTML soubor nebo prostý text. Následně výběrem požadovaného podpisu se vloží požadovaný text na požadované místo.

Dokud toto nebude dostupné v Thunderbuildu, pak práce v takovém emailovém klientu by pro mne nebyl posunem vpřed. Ale věřím, že toto naprogramovat je velmi jednoduché a pro uživatele to je velkým přínosem.

S pozdravem Pavel Cuc

---

Hello.

I almost switched to Thunderbild, but one missing feature stopped me.

I know that Thunderbild allows you to assign an "automatic" signature to each connected account. I can either use plain text, minor formatting in HTML or use an HTML file with the necessary formatting. That's OK.

But what I'm looking for is to insert signatures directly in the open email and to the currently positioned cursor. I guess it shouldn't be called insert signatures, but maybe insert template, because that better describes what is required.

The thing is, I have a lot of different replies or other texts prepared where inserting HTML text including formatting will make the routine easier. I haven't found anything like that here.

I'm attaching a picture of how this is elegantly handled in Windows Live Mail 2012, where I simply have a list of different signatures (about 25) and each refers to a specific HTML file or plain text. Then selecting the desired signature inserts the desired text in the desired location.

Until this is available in Thunderbuild, then working in such an email client would not be a step forward for me. But I believe this is very easy to program and a great benefit to the user.

Regards Pavel Cuc
creator: pcuc66

title: No “Apply filters on selected messages” menu item in Thunderbird 115.3.1 on XUbuntu 23.04
content:
Hello,

I have a long list of filters on a quite busy GMail account (>1000 messages per day). Traditionally there have been many times that new messages were eventually marked as not new because a refresh happened before the message filters were complete, so the very first filter marks all new messages with a specific label, and then all the next filters work on that specific filter, removing it when done.

For filters that didn't get applied to new messages for any reason, I only had to mark all the not-handled messages, tag them with the specific tag and then select “Run filters on selected messages”. This menu item does not exist anymore, and to replicate the functionality I have to go to the filters dialog, select all filters and then Run selected filters on my Inbox.

How can I have the menuitem “Run filters on selected messages” without needing to open the filters dialog?
creator: tzot

title: Filter for Emails
content:
Hi there

I am running Thunderbird, latest version, with several eMail accounts. I like the use of filters for each eMail account, so I can save important emails to my local folders. It turns out that I have very similar if not equal filter settings for different email accounts moving my emails into the same folder: Example Newsletter emails from different accounts to the same local folder.

Would it be possible to create one filter that searches all email accounts to do things (i.e. moving, attaching tags) to those emails?

Second use case: while manually scanning/reading emails tagging them, later having a global filter to move tagged emails to desired/configured folder.

I'd appreciate an answer.

Cheers Michael

title: Thunderbird improvvisamente bloccato

title: MS Exchange (Outlook) account disappearing when exiting Thunderbird
content:
Sorry this post is a bit verbose !

Thunderbird automatically updated two days ago, version now 115.3.2. I use it to work with a number of mail accounts, including an MS Exchange account. All worked OK before the Thunderbird update. Exquilla version is 115.3 and paid up.

After the Thunderbird update I found that the MS Exchange account had disappeared from Thunderbird. Re-adding this account through the Account Wizard appeared to work OK. But after successfully verifying my account, on the final "Congratulations window" it said to click Finish to save settings and exit account wizard. There was no Finish button to click on, only Back, Next and Cancel ones (see screenshot). Clicked Next : window disappeared.

And yes the MS Exchange account was then accessible in Thunderbird, and it synced OK (it's all still there online), and I could work with it, but only as long as I didn't exit Thunderbird ! When I re-loaded Thunderbird later after exiting it, the MS Exchange account was absent again. Contrary to what was stated, the account had not been saved. Tried this several times - same result.

This issue only affects my MS Exchange account : none of my gmail accounts nor my Xtra account were affected.

Have other people had the same problem ? If so, is this being looked into ? It would be very annoying to have to add the MS Exchange account again each time I load Thunderbird.

Thanks a lot for any help, Emile.
creator: ejbax

title: Pasting image into email error - 'Thunderbird has blocked a file from loading into this message'
content:
When pasting an image into a message, copied to the clipboard from another email message in Thunderbird, I get an error message saying 'Thunderbird has blocked a file from loading into this message. Unblocking the file will include it in your sent message.'

This is not a remote file, it has just been copied from another Thunderbird message into the clipboard. There is an Options button which shows the file location showing mailbox:///c:/users/(username etc).

In Tools/Settings/Privacy/Mail Content, I have ticked the 'Allow remote content in messages.'

In Exceptions, I have tried to add 'mailbox:///c:/users/' as a permitted location. Doesn't help. I still get the error message. It's a nuisance to have to dismiss it every time.

This is a new problem since upgrading to 115.3.1 (64-bit)

Thanks for your help.
creator: brianstokes
